titleStmt.title: Remarkable propositions by the councell in Ireland, humbly recommended to the Parliament in England, desiring them to move the judges to deliver their resolutions concerning the ensuing questions, being in number 21. Together with the declaration of both Houses of Parliament, Die Iovis 12. May, 1642. Ordered by the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament, that the said decalration shall be forthwith printed and published. John Brown Cler. Parl.
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Parliament.
England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: for W. G. and are to be sold by T. Bates,

notesStmt.note: At head of text on p. 3: Propositions by the Parliament in Ireland ...
"Die Iovis 12 May, 1642. The declaration of both Houses of Parliament" on p. 8 is a reprint of Steele 2127 (England); Wing (2nd ed) E1339A.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
